security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based security guidance skill that provides workflows and documentation for security validation tasks. It does not execute code, access files, or make network calls. The skill references standard security tools (GPG, SSH, Bandit, pip-audit, Safety, Semgrep) but only as documentation for what commands to run.

content.user_title: Validate Security and Scan for Vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: Developers need consistent security validation and vulnerability scanning to protect code from threats. This skill provides workflows for GPG/SSH key validation, security scanning with industry tools, and compliance checking against OWASP standards.
actual_capabilities: Guide GPG and SSH key validation workflows
Provide Bandit security scanner commands for Python
Run pip-audit and Safety checks for dependency vulnerabilities
Execute Semgrep scans with security rulesets
limitations: Provides workflows only - does not execute scans directly
Does not modify code to fix vulnerabilities
Does not access or scan external repositories
Requires security tools to be installed separately

use_cases.title: Secure Python Code
use_cases.description: Validate Python code for security vulnerabilities using Bandit and dependency scanning tools.

use_cases.title: Compliance Auditing
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive security checks and validate encryption keys before code releases.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Security Gates
use_cases.description: Implement security validation steps in deployment pipelines using recommended commands.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security audit on my code using the security skill. Check for secrets and validate my GPG signing configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan my codebase for vulnerabilities using Bandit and check my dependencies with pip-audit. Report any findings.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-Commit Security
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a pre-commit security checklist. Verify no secrets are committed and all security scans pass.

prompt_templates.title: Full Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security review using the security skill. Include GPG validation, Bandit scan, dependency audit, and Semgrep analysis.

best_practices: Run security scans before every code commit to catch issues early
Validate GPG and SSH keys regularly to ensure signing capability
Keep security tools updated to detect the latest vulnerabilities
anti_patterns: Skipping security scans to meet deadlines
Manually checking for secrets instead of using automated tools
Delaying dependency updates after vulnerability disclosures

faq.question: Which AI coding tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The security skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for security validation tasks.

faq.question: What security scanners does this skill recommend?
faq.answer: Bandit for Python code, pip-audit for dependencies, Safety for known vulnerabilities, and Semgrep for rules-based scanning.

faq.question: Does this skill fix vulnerabilities automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance and commands for scanning. Fixes require manual review and code changes.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides documentation and workflows. Code stays on your machine and scans run locally.

faq.question: Why are my security scans failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include outdated tools, missing dependencies, or actual security issues. Check tool installations and review scan output for specifics.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Security Advisory?
faq.answer: This skill provides local scanning workflows. GitHub Advisory offers database-driven vulnerability lookup. Use both for comprehensive coverage.
